translation.en: [woman 1 in Norwegian] I know it's Christmas,
translation.ja: 〈晴れだとクリスマスの 気分がしないから〉

translation.en: but you don't get into the holiday spirit when it's sunny.
translation.ja: 〈晴れだとクリスマスの 気分がしないから〉 〈ノルウェーに帰る〉

translation.en: -I need to get home to Norway. -[woman 2 on phone] Yeah.
-I'm so excited. -[woman 2] There's so much to do.
-It's okay, Mom. You've got time. -[mom] Yes, but still…
translation.ja: 〈ママ 時間はある〉 〈だけど…〉

translation.en: Has it been snowing a lot?
[mom] Sure, but tell me about your boyfriend!
translation.ja: 〈ええ でも恋人のことを教えて〉

translation.en: Well, you can meet him if you come to visit us.
translation.ja: 〈ここに来れば 彼に会えるよ〉

translation.en: We're settling in nicely. We're doing very well.

translation.ja: 〈荷物もほどいた ママ 待って〉
〈荷物もほどいた ママ 待って〉 ただいま

translation.en: Herregud? [in English] Is that a good thing?
I know you love Christmas, so I wanted to do something Christmas-themed for the…
translation.ja: 君はクリスマスが好きだから それをテーマに…

translation.en: And I know this might be early for Norwegian standards,
translation.ja: ノルウェーでは 早いと思うけど

translation.en: but, in India, we would have had two kids already and they would be in college.
translation.ja: インドでは 大学生の子供がいる頃だ

translation.en: So, if you're not, like, doing anything for the next couple of decades…
translation.ja: 今後 数十年間 特に何も予定がなかったら…
本気で言ってるの？ まだ私のミドルネームを 知らないでしょ

translation.en: -[chuckles] -[Thea] Uh… You don't even know my middle name. [laughs]

translation.en: And did you actually also know
that I have diabetes running in my family and that's…

translation.en: You haven't even met my family yet.
But when you know, you know.

translation.en: Look, the rules say you have to say yes or no.

そうね 分かった　いいわ

translation.en: joining me and my family for Christmas in Norway this year?

translation.en: [sighs] I would love to, but it's like you don't know my middle name.
translation.ja: でも君は まだ僕の ミドルネームを知らない…

translation.en: -[man] Yes. Of course. I would love to. -Yeah?
Oh, you have so much to look forward to. -Christmas in Norway is… is the best. -Mm-hmm.

translation.en: -So my family doesn't really know that-- -Is it jool or jul?

translation.en: -Uh, jul. Yeah, it's jul. Yeah. -Jul? Okay, jul.

言いかけたのは… ああ

is super excited to see you.

Are you gonna be like this the whole time?
It's just a family sweater tradition thing that we've been doing forever.

Uh, yeah, dude. Have you ever been?

“毎年 同じことをする ジェームズ”

translation.ja: 毎年 クリスマスの飾りを 作るのが

And when did you make this? [laughs]

translation.en: It's all wonky and messed up. It's so sweet.

translation.en: Yeah, he… he really loved Christmas.

-[in Norwegian] What's up with Balder? -Well, sometimes he reacts to…

translation.en: [hesitatingly] To… people who are so unfamiliar.

ロンメグロットを作ったの

translation.en: [in Norwegian] It's very nice that you made some, but I think…
translation.ja: 〈作ってくれて うれしいけど〉 〈機内で食べたの〉

I think we're gonna go to bed.
-[Thea] Yeah. I know. -Look at your earrings.

-But this is like a different person. -Yeah, but it's a posh period.

translation.en: Oh, and, uh, who's this dude?

ホンクレ？ タック(ありがとう)

translation.en: [inhales, smacks lips] Uh, good night, mamma.
Sorry. Isn't that what you say in, uh, Norwegian? Mamma?
translation.ja: ノルウェー語は “ママ”だよね

translation.en: You… You don't have to call me that.
Oh, no. In India, your in-laws are like your parents.
translation.ja: いや インドでは 義母は親と同じだから

translation.en: So that's why I'm actually very happy to call you mamma.
translation.ja: いや インドでは 義母は親と同じだから “ママ”と呼びたい

translation.en: Yes, but… but we are in… in Telemark.
translation.ja: ここは保守的なテレマルクよ

translation.en: Okay. Uh, what… what would you prefer that I called you?
translation.ja: では 何て呼べばいい？

translation.en: But that's so, uh… It's so impersonal.
translation.ja: 何だか遠い感じがする

translation.en: No? Well, then, mamma it is.
translation.ja: ダメ？ なら“ママ”だ おやすみ ママ
なら“ママ”だ おやすみ ママ

translation.en: Do you think, uh, she likes me?
I was asking, do you think your mom likes me?
translation.ja: 君のお母さんに 僕は気に入られたと思う？

translation.en: You didn't tell her I was Indian.
translation.ja: インド人と言わなかった

translation.en: Yeah. So then, why not tell her?
translation.ja: でも何で彼女に 言わなかった？

translation.en: You know, my dad, he was like…
the one who would reason with her.
So if I told her, like, three weeks ago that we were engaged, she would…
translation.ja: 婚約のことを ３週間前に伝えてたら…

translation.en: -Photoshop me in a family card? -[Thea scoffs]
She would sit alone in her room…
translation.ja: 彼女は１人で部屋に座って…
インドの伝統など全て

translation.en: She would blow it totally out of proportion.
translation.ja: きっと大げさに騒ぎ立てる

translation.en: [female presenter] In India, we are often told that a daughter's place is with her in-laws.
translation.ja: インドでは 女性の家は 義理の家族の家です
この慣習は農村部だけでなく

translation.en: this practice is just as common in Indian cities as in the villages.
translation.ja: この慣習は農村部だけでなく 都市部でも一般的です

translation.en: -I've put on some coffee if you want. -[cup thuds on table]
Have you talked to Jørgen since…
[whispers] I know that it hasn't been easy for him either. The breakup.
translation.ja: 〈彼にとっても 別れは つらかったはず〉

translation.en: No, I'm sure it hasn't, but it was a long time ago, Mom.
translation.ja: 〈それはないわ もう大昔のことよ〉

translation.en: No, it's just a shame that it had to end like that.
translation.ja: 〈ただ あんな別れ方で 残念だと思ったの〉

translation.en: All that stuff just got too complicated.
Dad and I always thought it was going to be the two of you.
I'm going to get started on the rice pudding now
translation.ja: 〈ライスプディングを 作るの〉

translation.en: Dad always used to make it two days in advance. So I better get started.
translation.ja: 〈お父さんは いつも ２日前に作ったから〉

translation.en: You could have told me a little earlier
translation.ja: 〈もう少し早く 教えてくれたらよかった〉

translation.en: Is that okay to say, though? "Indian"? Is that allowed?
translation.ja: 〈インド人と言っても 問題ない？〉

translation.en: Yes, Mom. You can say Indian.
[Anne-Lise] Fine. But do I have to make two Christmas dinners now?

translation.en: I know that Norwegian and Indian cultures are incredibly different.
translation.ja: 〈ノルウェーと インドの文化は〉 〈全く違うのよ〉

translation.en: -What have you been googling now? -[Anne-Lise] I haven't been googling.
There's just so much to do before Christmas.
I have to prepare the medister meatballs, and then we have to get firewood.
translation.ja: 〈ミートボールを作って 薪(まき)を用意しないと〉

translation.en: Your brother gets stressed out if we don't have firewood.
translation.ja: 〈シィーメンは 薪にうるさい〉

translation.en: And now I might have to make two Christmas dinners.
translation.ja: 〈クリスマスディナーも ２種類要る〉

translation.en: I don't know your boyfriend, and I don't know what they eat in India for Christmas.
translation.ja: 〈インドでクリスマスに 何を食べるのか知らないわ〉

translation.en: Yeah, the sun doesn't rise until ten.
translation.ja: 太陽は10時まで昇らない

translation.en: Maybe we should give my mom a… a bit more time.

translation.en: You don't wanna tell her about the engagement?
No. Yeah. Of course I want to tell her. It's just--

translation.en: Do I need to ask for her permission or something?
No. No, no, no. That's not a thing here. We're very modern.

translation.en: [Jashan] Okay, well, then we should just tell her.
No need to keep it a secret, right?
I just want the timing to be right.

translation.en: When will the timing be right?
I just want her to get to know you.
see the side of you that I fell in love with.
-You want me to have sex with your mom? -[Thea laughs]
Fine. I just wasn't ready for this, but, you know, if that's local tradition…

translation.en: And then we can tell her.
It's going to be a perfect Christmas.

-[whispers in Norwegian] What did he say? -[chuckles]

I bring them with me, bro. Duh.

何？ 今日は12月22日なの

translation.en: It's the day before the day before the big day, and it's sort of like a big deal in our family.

I told you. In Norway, it's 24th.

その前の２日間も小さく祝う

〈小さな小さな クリスマスに〉

translation.en: [in Norwegian] It was a tradition, though.

translation.en: meatballs on Teeny Tiny Christmas, and you all really liked it.

translation.en: But maybe we can just give this a try?
Did you hear that? Did you hear that?
-It was just Dad turning in his grave. -[Hildegunn] Stop it.

translation.en: Ronja, Dad is joking. Grandpa is dead.

translation.en: [breathes shakily] May God be with him.
Thank you for keeping an open mind.
We've been eating meatballs every year.
[in English] Norwegians are a very accepting people.

[in English] Yeah. Maybe you can take it in English so that Jashan understands.

すごく いい香りね

Well, uh, my family is not Christian,

translation.en: so we do this funny thing of, like, we'll do a countdown to midnight,

translation.en: That sounds like New Year's here in Norway.
translation.ja: ノルウェーの新年みたい

translation.en: [Simen in Norwegian] "Sounds like"? It literally is.
And, you know, this year, I'm so happy to be here with all of you
translation.ja: 今年は みんなと一緒に

translation.en: and to get to share this part of my culture with you.
translation.ja: 僕の文化を 分かち合えてうれしい

translation.en: What is it? Are you okay?
-[in English] Is it that spicy? -No, it's really…
[coughing] I'm so sorry. It's very good. I just have to…
translation.ja: ごめんなさい ちょっと…

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] I'll go with Mom. -If you have to spit it out, use this.
Anne-Lise doesn't want it on her rug.
[in English] Yeah, just… Yeah, just… I just need to check.
[in Norwegian] You guys are being very dramatic.
-[in English] Mamma, water will not help. -[Anne-Lise] Excuse me?
translation.ja: ママ 水は効かない 何？

translation.en: It's… You need some dairy. Uh, if you have yogurt?
I don't know. I don't know. I really don't know.
translation.ja: 分からない 本当に
〈ダメだって〉 〈プディングはダメよ〉

translation.en: -Don't take the pudding. We need it for-- -Mom, come on! We don't have a choice.
translation.ja: 〈プディングはダメよ〉 〈しかたない〉

translation.en: But Dad said it needs to stay…
-[Simen in Norwegian] Oh, it burns. -Just go.
I think it needs more time to set.
translation.ja: 〈治まるまで 時間がかかりそうだ〉

translation.en: [in English] How many chilies did you use?
Spice is about more than just chilies. This is super mild.
translation.ja: スパイスを混ぜ すごくマイルドに作った

translation.en: There's a difference between Norwegian spicy and Indian spicy.
translation.ja: 辛いの定義が インドとノルウェーでは違う

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I don't know if Simen told you, but I lived in India for a couple of months after high school.
translation.ja: 〈私は高校卒業後 数カ月 インドにいたの〉

translation.en: [in English] Okay. Hildegunn, she… she… she… lived in India for several months.
translation.ja: ヒルデグンはインドに 数カ月 住んでたの

translation.en: -Oh! Oh, cool. That is cool. -[Hildegunn chuckles]
translation.ja: そうだったのか いいね

translation.en: I actually… [chuckles] I wanted to show you this.
translation.ja: 実は これを見せたかった

translation.en: What is it? Don't you like it?

translation.ja: そう？　ハッキリ言って

translation.en: [in Norwegian] It doesn't matter what it means, does it?
translation.ja: 〈意味なんて どうでもいい〉

translation.en: Thea, it is important because it's a tattoo.
It's cut into my body until I die.
I want to know what it says.
[in English] Hypothetically speaking, it might say gori.
translation.ja: “ゴリ”と 理解することができる

translation.en: That doesn't sound so bad. [chuckles] What… What does that mean?
translation.ja: 悪くなさそう どういう意味？

translation.en: White girl, that's… [inhales shakily] …exactly what I am.
translation.ja: 白人女性って まさに私のことね
つまり事実が書いてある

translation.en: I'm just gonna go help the others. Yeah.
translation.ja: みんなを手伝ってくる

translation.en: I think your "poopadoonk" was a little bit dry, by the way.
translation.ja: インドのパンは 少しパサついてた

translation.en: Maybe tomorrow we can try to do Christmas the Norwegian way?
translation.ja: 明日はノルウェー式の クリスマスにしよう
ああ ノルウェー式って？
12月23日 （小さなクリスマス） 滑るぞ

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] "Out on a hike, what's not to like?"
[Simen] Out on a hike, what's not to…
[Jashan in English] Wow. How's she doing that?
In Norway we say that Norwegians are born with skis on their feet.
translation.ja: 私たちはスキーを履いて 生まれてくる

translation.en: Yeah? Sounds like a painful childbirth.
translation.ja: 出産する時 痛そうだ

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Out on a hike, what's not to like?
-Okay. Come on. I can help you. -[Jashan panting]
We have this lunch place just on the other side of the hill.
translation.ja: 丘の向こうで ランチが食べられる
いい？ ああ ランチができる

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Come on! Go, go, go!
[Jashan in English] Okay. So… So, what kind of food do they serve?
translation.ja: 大丈夫だ どんな料理があるの？

translation.en: So this is what we would call koselig in Norway.
translation.ja: 居心地がいい “コーシェリ”な場所よ

translation.en: No. It's just that when you said there was a lunch place,
translation.ja: ランチが食べられると聞いて

translation.en: you know, in my head, I thought there was gonna be…
translation.ja: 僕が頭の中で想像したのは…

translation.en: Yeah. No, that would be crazy if there was a restaurant.
translation.ja: こんな所にレストランが あるわけがない

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] So, what do you guys think?
Maybe you should go in advance?
So we can ski at our tempo, so he doesn't feel…
translation.ja: 〈私たちのペースで 滑るから〉

translation.en: I know, but it's a bit different.
But we're supposed to make gingerbread cookies together.
translation.ja: 〈でもクッキーは 一緒に作る〉

translation.en: Can't we make gingerbread cookies some other time?
Of course! We can move the gingerbread cookie making to Easter.
translation.ja: 〈ジンジャーブレッド クッキーは〉 〈イースターに作ろう〉

translation.en: -I need to pack the rucksack. -[Hildegunn] Take this…
Uh… We… The two of us can go together.
-Yeah. It's called koselig, right? -[Thea] We're home soon. I promise.
translation.ja: これがコーシェリだろ すぐ着く

translation.en: We just need to go down to Oksetjønn and take a left to Skjerdalen.
translation.ja: オクセジョンから シャダーレンへ行く

translation.en: Those names mean nothing. You're making them up.
translation.ja: その地名は適当に作った？

translation.en: -[sighs] -[Jashan] I won't do it. Leave me here.
Have you ever done this before?
My dad used to do it with me.

translation.ja: うまくいってるみたい ああ

translation.en: Do you want me to ask Simen to look for them?
translation.ja: 〈シィーメンに 見てきてもらう？〉

translation.en: No, let him relax. He's put on his comfy joggers…
translation.ja: 〈休ませてあげて〉 〈ゆったりパンツをはいて〉

translation.en: with a glass of Christmas soda in his hand,
translation.ja: 〈クリスマスソーダを 片手に〉

translation.en: getting into the spirit with Die Hard.
translation.ja: 〈「ダイ･ハード」の 世界に浸ってる〉
ああ そうみたいだね

translation.en: [Thea] It's just difficult without my dad.
translation.ja: パパがいないと難しい
サンタクロースだった

translation.en: And every year is just a reminder of what we lost.
translation.ja: 毎年 もういないと気付く

translation.en: And I really want them to like you because I love you.
translation.ja: 家族にも あなたを 好きになってほしい

translation.en: You know, in Norway, we call this koselig.
translation.ja: これをノルウェーでは コーシェリと言う

translation.en: [in English] You guys know each other?
That's crazy. What a small country.
translation.ja: 驚いた　何て小さな国だ

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Are you going somewhere? What are you doing here?
Anne-Lise called. She was worried that…
translation.ja: 〈アンネリーセから 電話があった〉

translation.en: -[Jashan in English] Hey. -I'm just telling him that we're not lost.
translation.ja: やあ 迷ってないと説明したの

translation.en: We're not lost. We're just going to "Oksischen" and "Shellbraider."
translation.ja: オクシジェンと シャルブライダーへ行くんだ

translation.en: You sure you don't want a ride?
-Dude, we would love a ride. -Yes. We're fine.

translation.ja: 本当？ 今 乗らないと言った？

translation.en: I'm not gonna ski back. Yes, we would love a ride.
translation.ja: 今 乗らないと言った？ 乗せてほしい

translation.en: -[Jørgen] Okay. -Thank you so much. That's amazing.
translation.ja: どうも ありがとう

translation.en: [gasps] Oh, dude, can I sit in the carriage?
[in English] Oh, God bless you, Jørgen.
translation.ja: 助かったよ ヨルゲン

translation.en: Dude, we're making something called "pepper cakes." You wanna come inside?
translation.ja: クッキーを作るけど 家に寄っていく？

translation.en: What do you mean, dude? You saved my life.
Come on. Come inside. We'll have a drink or something.
It might be a bit weird.
Why would it be weird? What? You guys used to hook up or something?
translation.ja: 何で？ ２人は恋人だったとか？

translation.en: Didn't really… get to that part.
translation.ja: その話は まだしてないの

translation.en: No, we just live together. We don't talk about stuff. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 一緒に住んでも話さない

translation.en: Oh, hey, see you around, dude.
[in English] So that's the guy from the picture in the stairway.
translation.ja: 彼が階段に飾ってあった 写真の人か
ええ ヘルメットを忘れた

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Don't you think you should get a new apron?
I've always had it. Lasse gave it to me when we were…
translation.ja: 〈ラッセがくれて ずっと使ってる〉

translation.en: So you thought it was a good idea to call my ex?
translation.ja: 〈何で元カレに 電話したの？〉

translation.en: I was worried about you two. I got scared.
translation.ja: 〈２人が心配で 怖くなったのよ〉

translation.en: Mom, that is a very weird thing to do.
Remember that before he was your ex, he was the kid next door.
translation.ja: 〈付き合う前から〉 〈彼は近所に住む 子供だった〉

translation.en: So if you think it's weird, it's because you're making it weird.
translation.ja: 〈変だと思うのは あなたの問題よ〉

translation.en: Yeah. I just can't figure out this house.
translation.ja: 家の作り方が分からない

translation.en: But I'm happy to be inside.
translation.ja: でも中にいられて うれしい

translation.en: It would have been nice to get some heads-up that your ex lives next door.
translation.ja: 元恋人が隣人だと 知らせてほしかった

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I almost forgot. When are we doing our Christmas dip tomorrow?
translation.ja: 〈明日 クリスマスの 水浴びをいつする？〉

translation.en: Can't we just do it when we wake up?
-[in English] Are you going to the… -Ah, you bet, Simen.
translation.ja: やるの？ ああ ノルウェーの クリスマスを満喫する

translation.en: I am here for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.ja: ああ ノルウェーの クリスマスを満喫する

translation.en: No, Jashan, you don't really need to do that.
Oh, that's nice that you're joining us for isbading.
translation.ja: まあ イースバーディングに 参加するのね

translation.en: I am very happy to join you for… what?
translation.ja: 楽しみだ　でも何をするの？
まさか そのまさか
12月24日 （クリスマスの朝） どうかしてる 12月24日 （クリスマスの朝）
体にいい いいわけない

translation.en: You said you wanted the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
Yeah, but that was before I knew you guys were crazy.
translation.ja: これは どうかしてる
〈あら〉 当然 彼も来る
全員で… やあ やる？

translation.en: Isn't it a bit too cold for him?
-Uh… -[in English] It's a bit too cold for you.
Oh, no, no. I was just actually warming up before I went in.
translation.ja: いや 入る前に温まった

translation.en: -[Jørgen] You must be cold. [laughs] -[Anne-Lise] Not at all.
It's so nice that you came.
Merry Christmas. This is so nice. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 〈メリークリスマス うれしいわ〉

translation.en: [in English] I have to admit, I hated it when these two little birds
translation.ja: 僕も初めて２人に 寒中水泳を強制された時は

translation.en: forced me into ice bathing for the first time. [laughs]
Well, actually, you know, no one's forcing me, so…
translation.ja: 誰にも強制されてない

translation.en: -Oh. No, no, no. Of course. -[Jashan] Yeah. Yeah.

translation.ja: 実は 僕がここに来たのは

translation.en: for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.ja: ノルウェーのクリスマスを 満喫するためだ

translation.en: Jash, you really don't have to do it. It's fine.
[whispers in English] I didn't know you were Christian.
Why are we in a church?
And because Ronja is in the choir, and she is looking forward to her solo.
translation.ja: それにロニヤが聖歌隊で ソロを歌うから

translation.en: ♪ In the soul's joyful pilgrim song ♪
translation.ja: 〈魂の喜びに満ちた 　　　　　巡礼者の歌に〉

translation.en: [Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ Angels first sang it ♪
[Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ In joy it passed ♪
[in English] Yeah, but it's too loud.

translation.ja: 君たちのは ささやき

translation.en: [singing quietly in bad Norwegian accent] ♪ Peace over Earth ♪
[whispers in bad accent] ♪ A savior for all time is born ♪
Before we go out into this beautiful Christmas Day,
translation.ja: 〈美しいクリスマスの日を 始める前に〉
〈テレマルク･ソウル･ チルドレン聖歌隊が〉

translation.en: wish you a Merry Christmas with this--
translation.ja: 〈メリークリスマスを 祈ります〉

translation.en: [in Norwegian] With this delightful Christmas classic.
translation.ja: 〈伝統的な クリスマスの曲です〉

translation.en: You're the one who said ice bathing was a good idea.
translation.ja: 寒中水泳は体にいいと
やめて ジャシャン

translation.en: Fine. I'll go out in the cold.
translation.ja: ああ 寒い外に出る
ジャシャン 静かに

translation.en: [Jashan] I'm sure freezing temperature will help.
translation.ja: 凍るような寒さは体にいい
ジャシュ 〈静かに　後で〉

translation.en: Can you hear me? Hello. Hi.
They just come to church for Christmas.
They do weird things, and when I ask why, it's just tradition.
translation.ja: 〈妙な行動の理由を聞くと 彼らは伝統だと言う〉

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thea, can you please stop your boyfriend?
[Jashan in Hindi] They do weird things all the time. If you ask why, "That's just how it is…"
translation.ja: 〈妙なことばかりして こういうものだと言う〉

translation.en: [whispering in English] How do you say, "I'm sorry, Ronja"?
translation.ja: “ごめん ロニヤ”と言いたい

translation.en: I'm not talking about the church.
I thought it'd be fun to bring my loudest kurta to a Christmas party but…
translation.ja: ド派手なクルタを クリスマス用に持ってきたが

translation.en: -Uh, can you help me with this? -[Jashan] Sure.
-Okay. So you just want it to kind of go… -[Jashan sniffles]

translation.ja: こんな感じで… やめて

translation.en: Sorry. I just… It's… Yeah, just try again.
translation.ja: ごめん もう１回やって

translation.en: Like I needed more proof I didn't fit in here. [sniffles]
translation.ja: なじめなくて失敗ばかり

translation.en: It's like, you can't really wear jewelry
translation.ja: 伝統衣装の ブーナッドを着る時は

translation.en: Something called bunad police. It's like a traditional thing.
translation.ja: 伝統的な決まりなのよ

translation.en: You know what? I'll just go and ask my mom.
translation.ja: やっぱり ママに手伝ってもらう

translation.en: Jashan is sorry for ruining your moment in church.
There's not much left for him to ruin now.
translation.ja: 〈もう邪魔される 心配もない〉

translation.en: We've been through all the crazy stuff leading up to Christmas.
translation.ja: クリスマス前の 妙な行事は済ませた

translation.en: Hot dog on the grill, um, church, not to mention Christmas bathing.
translation.ja: ホットドッグを焼き 教会へ行き クリスマスの水浴びをした

translation.en: Don't call it Christmas bathing. It makes it sound fun.
translation.ja: 寒中水泳を楽しそうに言うな
クリスマスディナーだけ

translation.en: We eat some cookies. We, uh, open presents.
translation.ja: クッキーを食べて プレゼントを開ける

translation.en: And by the end of the night,
I think we should tell them. We should break the news about our engagement.
translation.ja: みんなに婚約のことを 伝えるべきだと思う

translation.en: -All right. Yeah. We're telling them. -[Thea] Okay.
translation.ja: よし ええ みんなに話そう

translation.en: -[Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Do you like it? -Great crispy pork crackling, Mom.
Oh no. Maybe you… you can't eat pig.
translation.ja: もしかして 豚は食べられない？

translation.en: Uh, I'm Hindu. Muslims don't eat pork.
translation.ja: ヒンドゥー教は食べる

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Yes, of course. -Yes. I remember now.
translation.ja: 〈そうだった 豚肉はイスラム教よね〉

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Ronja, you have to eat your food, not just move it around.
translation.ja: 〈ロニヤ きちんと食べて〉

translation.en: Grandma has spent so much time making it. You have to taste it. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 〈おばあちゃんが 作ってくれたから食べて〉

translation.en: Sauce. Yes. What sauce is this?
translation.ja: いいね　何のソース？

translation.en: -You have to have it. -It's very good.
translation.ja: 試して おいしいわよ

translation.en: [Simen in Norwegian] Otherwise, it'll be too dry.
And what kind of fat is this?
Oh, no, no. It's not fat.

translation.ja: 生命の水 アクアビットだ

translation.en: You know, it's the potato booze I was telling you about?
translation.ja: ジャガイモの蒸留酒よ

translation.en: Yeah. But you don't need to do the whole shot.
I don't think that's so smart, but…
-Uh, do you want… -No. No. I'm not drinking.
[whispers] How am I supposed to finish this?
[in Hindi] Now this is more like it!
[in English] I'm so glad you liked it.

translation.ja: 気に入った？　最高だ

translation.en: [Jashan] Hindu is a Norwegian spice brand?
translation.ja: 香辛料のブランド名が “ヒンドゥー”？
ブラックボーイ？ もう やめて

translation.en: …as an Indian person, I never thought I would be offended by spices.
translation.ja: スパイスに侮辱されるとは 思わなかった

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Has he been seasoning my pork with garlic powder and piri-piri?
translation.ja: 〈豚肉にニンニクと ピリピリをかけてたの？〉

translation.en: No disrespect, but I use an entire garlic to fry an egg.
translation.ja: 申し訳ないけど 僕は卵１個に ニンニクを１玉使う

translation.en: …unseasoned pork with crunchy fat and chewy fat and fat sauce.
translation.ja: 味のない硬い豚の脂に 脂のソースをかけて食べる

translation.en: Why do you have Black Boy and Hindu spices in your house?
translation.ja: 何のためにスパイスがある？

translation.en: Well, if he doesn't like it, then I'm sure we have a lot of curries that Shazam--
translation.ja: 嫌ならシャザムのカレーが…

translation.en: Okay? Not Shazam. Not Sasham. It's Jashan.
translation.ja: シャザムでも サシャムでもない

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I'll go and get some more sausages.
[whispering in English] Can you please just try to fit in?
[softly] Like Hildegunn who pretends like she has no personality
so she can fit into your Norwegian Christmas cult.
translation.ja: クリスマスカルトに 合わせてる

translation.en: Yeah. Christmas cult, with your crazy uniforms and your weird rituals.
translation.ja: 妙な制服を着て 変な儀式を行うカルト集団だ

translation.en: I'm not asking you to dye your hair blond or to speak Norwegian.
translation.ja: 金髪に染めてとか ノルウェー語を話してとか 言ってない

translation.en: -[doorbell rings] -I just want my family to be happy for us.
Why would they be happy for us if you force me to eat pork fat?
translation.ja: 僕が脂を無理に食べると 喜ぶの？

translation.en: So is baby tossing and human sacrifice and stoning.
translation.ja: 人柱も石打ちの刑も伝統だ

translation.en: Just because it's tradition doesn't mean it's good.
translation.ja: 伝統がいいとは限らない

translation.en: [in English] Can we please talk about this later?

translation.ja: 嫌だ　僕は怒ってる

translation.en: And is that the answer for everything?
Why do atheists go to church? It's Christmas.
translation.ja: 教会へ行くのも 寒中水泳をするのも

translation.en: Why do we swim in ice water? It's Christmas.
translation.ja: 教会へ行くのも 寒中水泳をするのも 感情を隠すのも クリスマスだから

translation.en: Why do we hide our feelings? It's Christmas.
translation.ja: 感情を隠すのも クリスマスだから

translation.en: [Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Thea, Santa is here!
translation.ja: 〈テア サンタクロースが 来たわ〉

translation.en: What does it say on this one?
-[in Norwegian] Come on, Aunt Thea. -You must come and get your present.
translation.ja: 〈来て〉 〈さあ プレゼントを〉

translation.en: Maybe you want to sit on Santa's lap?
-You have to sit. -Yes, you have to sit.
[Jørgen] There we go. This is cozy.
translation.ja: 〈そうだ 座り心地がいいだろう〉

translation.en: Have you been a good girl this year, Aunt Thea?
translation.ja: 〈今年は いい子だったかい？〉

translation.en: [in English] I'm sorry. Am I the only one who finds this weird?
translation.ja: 茶番だと思うのは僕だけ？
ジャシャン 子供の前よ

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Maybe someone is upset he's not getting a present from Santa this year?
translation.ja: 〈プレゼントがなくて 怒ってるのかも〉

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Well, it's getting late, little Ronja.
translation.ja: 〈もう遅くなってきた 小さなロニヤ〉

translation.en: and the night is still young.

translation.ja: 〈皆さん メリークリスマス〉

translation.en: -[in English] Yeah. -What the fuck, man? Don't push me.
I think Santa should get going. [sighs]
translation.ja: 〈もうサンタクロースは 帰ることにする〉

translation.en: Because you don't fit in to this Christmas cult?
translation.ja: クリスマスカルトに 合わないから？

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Let's bring the candy to… -[Jashan sighs]
-[Simen] I'm gonna chop some wood. -[Anne-Lise] I'll start the dishes.
[in English] Do you think that's what it's about?
I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your family,
translation.ja: 君の家族や家の伝統に

translation.en: and I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your traditions.
translation.ja: 合わせるのは難しいと 知ってた

translation.en: And if you came to India, you would have a hard time fitting in too.
translation.ja: インドに来たら君も苦労する

translation.en: The difference is, I would have had your back. [exhales]
translation.ja: でも僕なら君を支える

translation.en: Or are you someone so obsessed with making Christmas perfect that you lost sight of me?
translation.ja: 完璧なクリスマスを 僕よりも優先した

translation.en: Then why won't you tell your family we're engaged?
translation.ja: では なぜ婚約を隠す？

translation.en: I was just waiting for the right moment.
translation.ja: いいタイミングを待ってた

translation.en: -So, listen to some music, or do you… -[Jashan] I'm okay.
translation.ja: 何か音楽を聴く？ それとも… 大丈夫

translation.en: [driver] Yes. But we can be silent. That's all. No problem.
translation.ja: 静かなのもいい　問題ない

translation.en: [Thea in Norwegian] Look at the nice colors.
No. You can't be sad on Christmas Eve.
translation.ja: 〈クリスマスイブに 悲しむ人はいない〉

translation.en: There are many presents left, Ronja. Why don't you go get one more?
translation.ja: 〈ロニヤ まだプレゼントが あるから開けたら？〉
〈“メリークリスマス テア”〉

translation.en: [voice breaks] He is actually really cool.
[whispers] It wasn't Santa. It was just Jørgen who was pretending because he is in love with you.
translation.ja: 〈あれは おばさんが好きで 仮装してきたヨルゲンよ〉

translation.en: I don't think he's actually in love. [sniffles]
But Jashan ruined your song in church, and you were so excited about it.
translation.ja: 〈ジャシャンは教会で〉 〈ロニヤが楽しみにしてた 歌を台なしにした〉

translation.en: Not really. I just sang because Mom says that Grandma wants me to.
translation.ja: 〈おばあちゃんが喜ぶと ママに言われて歌ったの〉

translation.en: [Hildegunn] No, Ronja. [chuckling] It wasn't quite like that.
translation.ja: 〈やだ ロニヤ そんなこと言ってない〉

translation.en: I like it when the children sing.
translation.ja: 〈子供の歌を 聴くのは好きよ〉

translation.en: I was thinking. Your bunad is so beautiful.
translation.ja: 〈ところで アンネリーセのブーナドは〉 〈すごく美しいわ〉

translation.en: -I don't give a shit. -You can't say "shit."
No, I'm not sure, Mom. I'm not.
I just can't listen to you right now.
And I know you think that my relationship with Jashan is just a phase
translation.ja: 〈ママは 彼との関係が 一時的だと思ってるでしょ〉

translation.en: because I've messed around so much.
[whispers] Maybe you should go and play with your Christmas gifts.
I've just tried to make everything right this Christmas
translation.ja: 〈完璧なクリスマスに しようと努力した〉

translation.en: because I know it's important to you and because
translation.ja: 〈パパと過ごした クリスマスみたいに〉

translation.en: I wanted to do it like we always did it with Dad
translation.ja: 〈パパと過ごした クリスマスみたいに〉 〈したかった〉

translation.en: to help Jashan fit in and… [sobs]
And to make you like him.
But it's not mine or Jashan's job to make you like him.
translation.ja: 〈でも みんなが彼を 好きになるように〉 〈することはできない〉

translation.en: [sniffles] This was supposed to be happy news, but I might as well say it now since everyone is in such great spirits.
translation.ja: 〈みんなを喜ばせたかった でも今 言うわ〉

translation.en: Pretty stupid to throw him out on Christmas Eve, then.

translation.ja: 〈あなたがヨルゲンと 交際した時〉

translation.en: I thought my life was perfect.
translation.ja: 〈私の人生は 完璧だと思った〉

translation.en: You were supposed to live in the house next door,
translation.ja: 〈あなたは 私たちの家の隣に住む〉

translation.en: and your kids were supposed to come to our house to do homework
translation.ja: 〈孫たちが家に来て〉 〈宿題をして おやつを食べる〉
〈宿題をして おやつを食べる〉

translation.en: But then, Dad died. And you left.
translation.ja: 〈でも お父さんが死に あなたも家を出た〉

translation.en: I'm the one who should say sorry.
I'm just afraid to lose you.
There is a reason you don't drink alcohol on Christmas Eve.
You didn't all have to come with me.
Of course we had to come. We all have to apologize.
Can we please slow down a bit?
We are on our way to the airport on Christmas Eve.
translation.ja: 〈婚約者を追って イブに空港へ行く〉

translation.en: We're getting her fiancé. This is the most romantic thing I've ever experienced.
translation.ja: 〈婚約者を追って イブに空港へ行く〉 〈最高にロマンチックよ〉

translation.en: -Shut up, please. -Saying shut up is not allowed.
Your mom is allowed to say shut up.
translation.ja: 〈“黙って”と言っても いいのよ〉

translation.en: We're not going to make it.
Of course we're going to make it.

translation.ja: ごめんなさい ジャシャン
私が全て台なしにした

translation.en: And you were totally right about everything you said
translation.ja: あなたの言ったことは 正しいけど

translation.en: about me not having your back.
translation.ja: あなたを支えようとした

translation.en: I'm sorry I didn't tell them about the engagement.
translation.ja: 婚約を黙っていて ごめん

translation.en: I just… I don't know. I thought it would be easier that way.
translation.ja: そのほうが楽だと思ったの

translation.en: How… How did you get inside the airport?
[Anne-Lise] Do you think Santa will come tonight?
translation.ja: 今夜 サンタは来るかな

translation.en: [Jashan] I don't think Santa's gonna come after last year.
translation.ja: 去年のことがあるから 来ないよ
〈“ジャシャンへ アンネリーセより”〉
やった ありがとう

translation.en: [in English] Oh, I wonder what it is.
You know what, Jashan, I, uh…
I just have to say I loved the tikka ma-pinnekjøtt.
translation.ja: ティカ･マピンネショットは おいしかった

translation.en: Thank you very much, man, but it was all her idea.
translation.ja: ありがとう　でも彼女の案だ

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thank you so much, Anne-Lise.
THE REAL "JASHAN" & "THEA" ♪ Come on and do the bhangra everybody ♪ ♪ Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey ♪
translation.ja: 本物の〝ジャシャン〞と 〝テア〞

translation.en: If you like this, you're going to love the wedding in India.
translation.ja: ならインドの結婚式も 気に入る

translation.en: I was going to tell you.

translation.ja: ジャスト･ア･ メリークリスマス
